title: Haiyan reaches the Philippeans. This typhoon was the strongest storm recorded at landfall. 748,572 people evacuated. 4.3 million people affected.— Wikipedia and Wall Street Journal
85% of phone networks restored in the three worst-affected regions of the Philippeans. 13 million people affected by the typhoon. Nearly 4,000 dead and 648,000 damaged houses. — Wall Street Journal

Cash for work program. The 'Buddhist Tzu Chi Foundation' from Taiwan organizes the most comprehensive disaster response in a program that involved up to 31,000 people per day cleaning thousands of tons of debris. This program also injected cash into the economy.— Wikipedia

New totals from OCHA:
  • over 14 million people affected
  • over 4 million people displaced
  • over 1 million damaged houses
  • 6,201 reported deaths
  • 1,785 people mission
— The Christian Science Monitor
